title: Sherbourne River Valley Walk Route

images.title: E Gammie / River Sherbourne
images.caption: River Sherbourne. The river meanders from the brick footbridge (obscured by small tree left of centre) towards the Coundon Wedge road.

images.title: River Sherbourne, Coventry by JThomas, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: River Sherbourne, Coventry. The river flows under the centre of the city of Coventry. The source of the river is in the fields near Hawkes End in the parish of Allesley. It flows for about 8 miles or 13 km in a generally southeastern direction. In the centre of Coventry it flows through Spon End (where it is spanned by Vignoles Bridge) and it is culverted just before it reaches the Inner Ring Road and Spon Street, and continues through the suburb of Whitley. It joins the River Sowe (a tributary of the River Avon) south of the A45 road near Baginton.

images.title: E Gammie / Sherbourne valley
images.caption: Looking across the valley of the River Sherbourne near Allesley village.

images.title: Julian P Guffogg / Sherbourne Valley near Mill Corner
images.caption: Sherbourne Valley near Mill Corner

images.title: John Winterbottom / Footpath Near Pikers Lane
images.caption: Footpath Near Pikers Lane and the river source.

description: This waymarked trail follows the Sherbourne River through the city of Coventry and the surrounding countryside. The walk starts just south of the city and heads north through Coventry before emerging into the countryside and finishing at Corley Moor. Here the trail links with the Coventry Way so it's easy to continue your walk if you have time. On the way there's some pleasant waterside stretches and lovely views of the surrounding hills and countryside.
display_address: Scimitar Way, Willenhall, Coventry, West Midlands, England, CV3 4GB, United Kingdom
